found_issues.title: [HW] Make `hw::getBitWidth` use std::optional vs -1
found_issues.reason: Directly addresses the root cause: getBitWidth() returning -1 for unsupported types and the need to handle it properly. Planned fix to use std::optional instead of -1. This is the exact root cause of our crash.

found_issues.title: [LLHD] Mem2Reg crash on reasonable input
found_issues.reason: Similar Mem2Reg crash in LLHD with integer bitwidth issue. Different root cause but same error location and pass. Shows Mem2Reg has multiple crash points.

found_issues.title: [LLHD] Mem2Reg creates drives to read-only signals
found_issues.reason: Related Mem2Reg bug, but focuses on correctness of drives rather than crash. Still same Mem2Reg pass.

found_issues.title: [LLHD] Mem2Reg does not properly combine enables of successive drives
found_issues.reason: Related Mem2Reg bug. Same pass and component but different issue type (logic bug vs crash).

found_issues.title: [Mem2Reg] Local signal does not dominate final drive
found_issues.reason: Open Mem2Reg issue, same pass but different problem type. Indicates ongoing issues with Mem2Reg.

found_issues.title: [MooreToCore] Crash with sqrt/floor
found_issues.reason: MooreToCore crash, different component but also calls getBitWidth() and crashes with IntegerType issue.

found_issues.title: [Moore] Mem2Reg Error
found_issues.reason: Mem2Reg error on Moore types. Very similar - Mem2Reg processing Moore dialect with type errors. Shows Mem2Reg doesn't properly handle Moore types like ClassHandleType.

analysis.direct_match: Issue #9287 is directly addressing the root cause. It's an open issue about making getBitWidth() return std::optional instead of -1, which would prevent this crash entirely.
analysis.likely_duplicate_of: #9287 is the core issue; this crash is a manifestation of that problem
analysis.uniqueness_assessment: This testcase is UNIQUE. While it's caused by the same root problem as #9287, the specific trigger (SystemVerilog class with self-referential typedef in Mem2Reg pass on Moore dialect) is a new and specific way of reproducing the issue.
analysis.crash_signature: Mem2Reg.cpp:1742 - IntegerType::get() assertion failure with bitwidth > 16777215
